summary: This document is an email exchange from February 18, 2025, between journalist Daniel Bates and an unnamed recipient. Bates discusses his past reporting on Jeffrey Epstein's connections to Peter Mandelson and Andrew, and proposes collaborating on further reporting, possibly for the Daily Mail.

persons.name: Daniel Bates
persons.context: The sender of the emails, a journalist who claims to have done leg work on stories about Epstein's connections to Peter Mandelson and Andrew. He is proposing collaboration on further reporting.

persons.name: Guy Adams
persons.context: Mentioned as the journalist who took the lead on a story about Epstein, for which Daniel Bates claims to have done the leg work.

persons.name: Peter Mandelson
persons.context: A British political figure who was the subject of Daniel Bates's past reporting regarding scheduled meetings with Jeffrey Epstein and a plan for a consultancy business involving Epstein, Andrew, and Mandelson.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case, referenced in connection to plans for a consultancy business with Andrew and Peter Mandelson, and for having scheduled meetings with Mandelson.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.context: Presumably Prince Andrew, mentioned in the context of a plan with Jeffrey Epstein and Peter Mandelson to form a new consultancy business where they would be 'star advisers'.

persons.name: Murdoch
persons.context: Referenced as a media figure whom the email recipient is allegedly not a fan of, influencing Bates's suggestion to work with the Mail instead.

connections.description: Daniel Bates has reported on Peter Mandelson's connections to Jeffrey Epstein, as evidenced by his provided article links.
Collaborated on a story about Epstein, with Adams taking the lead and Bates doing the leg work.
Had scheduled meetings, and there was a plan for them and Andrew to be star advisers in a new consultancy business, according to Bates's reporting.
Part of a plan with Peter Mandelson to form a new consultancy business where they would be star advisers.
Planned alongside Jeffrey Epstein to be star advisers in a new consultancy business.

events.title: Publication of Epstein-Mandelson Articles
events.description: Daniel Bates references his past reporting for the Daily Mail on articles detailing Epstein's plan to make Andrew and Peter Mandelson star advisers in a new consultancy, and on Mandelson's scheduled meetings with Epstein.

events.title: Email Exchange on Epstein Reporting
events.description: Journalist Daniel Bates emails an unnamed recipient, discussing past reporting on Epstein's connections to Mandelson and Andrew, and proposing future collaboration, possibly with the Daily Mail.

keyFacts: The document is a 2025 email from journalist Daniel Bates discussing ongoing media interest in the Epstein case, specifically connections to Peter Mandelson and Andrew.
Bates claims to have done the leg work for Daily Mail articles reporting on a plan for Epstein, Andrew, and Mandelson to be 'star advisers' in a new consultancy business.
Bates references other reporting on multiple scheduled meetings between Peter Mandelson and Jeffrey Epstein.
The email suggests Mandelson's political power has increased since the original reporting, making the story more relevant.
Bates proposes collaborating on further reporting, potentially for the Daily Mail, noting the recipient's alleged dislike of media mogul Murdoch.
